snippet: President Recep Tayyip Erdogan, whose officials had compiled lists of those with questionable loyalties, has labeled many civil servants as potential enemies of the state....
abstract: Attempted military coup in Turkey was culmination of yearslong struggle for control between allies of Pres Recep Tayyip Erdogan and collection of enemies including members of military and followers of Muslim cleric Fethullah Gulen; failed attempt could set off dramatic restructuring of Turkish state.

byline.original: By BEN HUBBARD, TIM ARANGO and CEYLAN YEGINSU
byline.contributor: Ben Hubbard reported from Ankara, and Tim Arango and Ceylan Yeginsu from Istanbul.

lead_paragraph: President Recep Tayyip Erdogan, whose officials had compiled lists of those with questionable loyalties, has labeled many civil servants as potential enemies of the state.

headline.main: Failed Turkish Coup Accelerated a Purge Years in the Making
headline.print_headline: Failed Turkish Coup Accelerated Purge That Was Years in the Making

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
